column4: dasei hey guys need your help: im trying super hard to install ubuntu but no luck... i md5sumed it and it checks out OK... my bios are set properly and i can see it with my hardrives...
i md5sum'd it tho, it checks out
you md5'd the iso, not the disc...
whats the difference? the only thing on the disk is the iso
dasei i would say that too except the issue is with 1 ubuntu disk and 2 backtrack cd's too... confusing...
dasei did i burnem all wrong?
yea, id say burn errors, try burning one again at 8x
yea, no reason to download again if the md5 checks out, just burn it again at a slow speed
dasei and guys, im burning ubuntu at slowest possible speed, 10x(K3B). is there a specific writing mode? or just leave it on auto?

i installed ubuntu, it asked for restart, so i did, it loads up on this screen where its talking aboiut broadcom and then PXE-E53: no boot filename recieved and then another cmd line with operating system not found
